;How to get out The hurt I have received

;
;
;
;
; Yin Yiyi answered
;
;

;

;;
;

;< br>;

;

;You should have fully understood that growth is one pit after another. These pits may be large or small. Small pits will only cause us a little trouble, but large pits may cause us lifelong trauma. Over time, we may gradually forget about those traumas. However, ;if we don’t face it, clean it up, and treat it, these latent traumas will suddenly make waves one day and induce various mental illnesses. ;

;

;Why does the long past still cause harm to us now? Why can’t we “get out” and “let go”?

;

;Research from the University of Adelaide in Australia shows that trauma experienced in childhood can damage the brain's adrenal hormone and oxytocin secretion systems, resulting in problems with the growth and development of the emotional control system. You may be more familiar with adrenaline, a hormone that is secreted in large amounts during stressful situations to prepare us for fight or flight. Oxytocin sounds like a substance unique to females, but it is actually a substance secreted by both men and women, commonly known as the "love hormone." Oxytocin can stimulate the desire to socialize, help people actively control emotions, feel love and give love. The amount of oxytocin produced in each person's body is different based on different genes and gender. One of the leading factors behind whether you are affable or dignified in your dealings with others is the magical oxytocin. The level of development of the oxytocin system greatly affects our ability to receive and feel love.

;

;The oxytocin system is located in the posterior lobe of the pituitary gland. Its growth and development begins when we are in the womb, continues to grow through infancy and childhood, and is finally finalized in adolescence. Psychological injuries, severe setbacks, or physical illnesses suffered during childhood will affect the growth and development of the oxytocin system, resulting in a significantly lower amount of oxytocin in the body as an adult.

;

;;If we think of the brain as a sophisticated instrument, then emotions are the center of this instrument. The biggest obstacle to the development of this center is trauma. ;We already know from existing research that trauma continues to harm people. Depression, anxiety, personality disorders, self-harm, rage, addiction, complex post-traumatic stress disorder and even suicide are all related to childhood trauma. Even if we have forgotten the trauma, sudden stress, such as the loss of a job, the loss of a loved one, or the dissolution of a marriage, can still trigger a trauma response and keep us trapped in the past.

;

; 

;

;;What ;;injury constitutes trauma;;? ;

;

;The decisive factor in determining whether an injury is "trauma" is not the severity of the injury, but the individual's feelings at the time. ;If you feel in danger and alone, that's trauma. ;

;

;When I was a child, I was very small and moved schools frequently, so I was often bullied. When I was eleven years old, I transferred from Heilongjiang to Shanghai. As soon as I entered the classroom, I could feel the unfriendliness of my classmates. The teacher shouted to me: "Hurry up and sit down, why are you standing there in a daze!" ”I still remember the embarrassing state of mind at that time.

;

;More than twenty years later, I went to a hospital to apply for a job. Because I needed to use a printer, I went to the front desk to ask for the printer password. The front desk staff yelled: "You don't know how to look for it yourself!" ”At that moment, the feeling of being at a loss suddenly emerged. I seemed to be in the classroom more than 20 years ago again. The teacher was shouting at me and the whole class was watching with cold eyes. I was extremely embarrassed and ashamed. Inexplicably, my eyes turned red at that time. Fortunately, all these years of professional training have not been lost. I quickly walked to the bathroom to calm down my emotions, and then accurately found the source of that familiar emotion in the dark room of emotions. In fact, it was the eleven-year-old me who was sad. ;When you know the source of your emotions, it will be easier to comfort yourself, and you won’t let the hurt continue, and you won’t belittle yourself easily. ;

;

;Sharing such experiences and feelings, some people may think that I am making a fuss out of a molehill - can such a small thing cause "trauma"? Doesn’t every child experience this? It may not be worth mentioning to others, but to me, it was trauma. ;Don’t use other people’s feelings as the standard, but pay more attention to your own inner experience, which is an important criterion for defining trauma. ;

;

; 

;

;;How to Deal with Inner Trauma;

;

;Healing from psychological trauma is very difficult. But;if you don’t pay attention to the pain of the past, the consequences may be more serious. The small splash of water stirred up in the past may turn into a huge wave after time brewing, swallowing us up now. ;

;

;I worked as a clinical counselor in a public hospital in one of the most deprived areas of London. The residents there have poor economic conditions and low education levels, so the people who came to see me were all patients with severe mental illness. One of the patients impressed me deeply. She was born in an Indian family that favored boys over girls, and she had been responsible for all the housework since she was a child. When she was five, her brother began sexually abusing her, which continued until she was married. What's even more frightening is that her parents have always acquiesced in her brother's behavior and forced her to take birth control pills. The marriage was also arranged by the parents.

;

;Growing up in such an environment, she suffered from long-term post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), along with depression and alcohol addiction. During the first diagnosis and treatment, she cried bitterly and told me that she felt that her life was hopeless. I handed her a tissue and gently told her: "But, you survived." You did very well. ”

;

;After that, I accompanied her on the journey of self-rescue. The root cause of post-traumatic stress disorder is "the reoccurrence of past injuries in the present." Although the sexual assault ended after she got married, in her consciousness, she was still involved in it for more than 20 years. She would unconsciously replay those traumatic scenes in her mind, and then feel the fear, panic, anger, helplessness and sadness she felt at that time again and again.

;

;So, how should we deal with inner trauma? I usually use the ;following steps to help clients;.

;

;;The first step is to process the trauma in an emotionally stable state. ;It is difficult for people to think rationally under the impact of emotions, so first make sure that your emotions are stable enough, and then start healing. I often take deep breaths to calm myself before I receive a visitor.

;

;;The second step is to salvage memories. ;Sifting out the most painful memories from the thousands of thoughts in the past. If there is a lot of hurt, don't rush to remember it together. It takes patience and time to appease your heart.

;

;;The third step is to identify the emotions you felt when you were hurt. ;Was it shame, fear, humiliation, or anger? Only after you figure it out can you prescribe the right medicine.

;

;;The fourth step is to acknowledge the legitimacy of those feelings and forgive yourself for your initial inaction. ;What happened in the past may not seem like much now, but it was very serious to me at the time, so it became a knot in my heart. One thing is certain, I tried my best at that time.

;

;The most difficult step in treating post-traumatic sequelae is to recreate the traumatic history, which means creating a safe environment to allow the patient to repeatedly face the person he or she has been hurt by, and to become psychologically desensitized step by step. . This part is very painful. It is not an exaggeration to describe it as painful as picking off bones. ;Just like my female patient, she broke down and got angry many times, and mentioning those injuries was like opening unhealed wounds again and again. Her narrative is laced with remembered sights, sounds, smells and physical pain. She said that the betrayal of her parents and brother broke her trust in the entire world and made her lose her sense of security, which she could not make up for even after having her own family. At this time, the psychological counselor must help the patient re-establish rules and boundaries while ensuring safety. Just like a film editor, he re-edits the fragments into a movie and gives them a new meaning. These meanings include: becoming more aware of one's own reactions to stress, reintegrating one's worldview, getting along better with oneself, and rebuilding reliable social networks.

;

;After one year of treatment, she plucked up the courage to file a lawsuit against her brother and found a new job that suited her. She also founded a charity to help Indian women who have been through the same thing as her. She said: "I used to really long for my mother to admit that my brother had sexually assaulted me, instead of ignoring my pain just because I was a woman." My brother and I are both her children, right? Now I know that I have the ability to face my pain, even if the whole world chooses to ignore it. ;Just because you haven't been cherished doesn't mean you can't learn to cherish it. This may be the meaning of pain. ;”

;Text/Ma Chenwei

;

;

;;
;
;
; 
;

;From hometown to city, from city to hometown, the sense of belonging slowly dies, family affection, love, Friendship is all buried with the dead. When walking in a maze and can't find the direction, backtracking is also a way out.

;
;

;
;

;

;;1.;

;

;Mingfang works as an operator in an Internet company. Her work station is outside. I can see the landmark TV tower in H City. My colleague said that the city looks very big, but the only place where people really live their lives is the area where the TV tower can be seen with the naked eye. Urban planning uses this to draw a circle and divide life and survival.

;

;Mingfang was noncommittal, thinking about the streets here more than ten years ago: half-demolished crumbling residential buildings, middle-aged people carrying spittoons into public toilets on summer mornings, dried fish in the lanes, The smell of fried dough sticks, the cold and humid winter air inhaled into the nose, and the faint fragrance of elegant frost. Mingfang followed her parents and the construction team in the village who brought her whole family to the village to continue demolition and construction. Among the ruins, construction sites and rough materials, she completed the most primitive "disenchantment" of the place. At that time, many people, including Mingfang, did not have an overlooking perspective and had no floating tone. They all thought that they could sneak into it with intelligence and diligence, and then stay here decently and for a long time.

;

;No matter how unrealistic the words are, colleagues in the company, like Mingfang, cannot afford to rent a house near the company, and the daily commuting time alone takes up four to five hours. She shared a house with others, which was said to be two bedrooms and one living room. In fact, the living room was just a narrow corridor. The girl who originally lived in the next room fell in love with her boyfriend and moved out. The second landlord brought a new family, sister, brother-in-law and brother. The door of the room was wide open, Mingfang took a sneak peek, and a shameful curtain was drawn between the two beds. Both men are always sloppy. Ming Fangqi was sitting on the toilet seat in a daze at night. She felt damp and turned on the light, and found urine hanging on the toilet seat. Mingfang wanted to knock on the door and quarrel, but was afraid of something happening in the middle of the night, so she had to endure it.

;

;Mingfang browsed the housing listings on the rental software and could not find a place that was cheaper and more convenient than here. Mingfang thought, wait, wait until the salary on the bank card becomes more abundant, wait until she gets a promotion and a salary increase, or wait until she changes jobs.

;

;Mingfang doesn’t remember how she fell asleep, but she remembers that the dream was not good. Ever since her junior year in college, Mingfang dreamed that her two wisdom teeth had fallen out. When she woke up, she received a call from her mother asking her to go home. Her grandfather was doing a small job and on the day when the roof of the house was poured, he collapsed beside the cement pile and walked away. After that, Mingfang believed that dreams would give her predictions.

;

;She thought that the safest and most cost-effective way was to talk to the woman in that house and ask her to talk to the men and let them talk about hygiene. The woman was in a hurry to go out and agreed perfunctorily. Mingfang followed her out the door and ran ahead of her until she reached the breakfast shop at the subway entrance. Mingfang bought an extra portion of Shaomai and a cup of soy milk, hung them on the handle of the shared bicycle she unlocked, and said kindly: "Sorry to trouble you, everyone." None of it is easy. But that night was still the same as the day before. Mingfang had no choice but to find another woman, but the other woman said impatiently: I can't control them, and I don't have any control. Ming Fanghuo burst out and said: Come to the police station, you can't pee in the toilet, what's wrong with you? She took out her phone and saw three missed calls on the screen, from her mother. Mingfang didn't bother anymore, ran to the subway station and called back.

;

;Mingfang’s mother was sitting at the food stall in front of the cancer hospital, making fried noodles. There was a dollar of ice dew under the bench. Her grandmother was sitting in a wheelchair next to her, having just finished a bowl of porridge. Mingfang blamed her mother: Why didn't you tell her in advance? My mother asked back: Can I still choose the time when taking someone else’s car? Grandma's illness was diagnosed by the county hospital doctor, and my mother was worried. Many people came not to see a doctor in a big hospital, but to give up. Like Mingfang, my mother has lived in this city for many years. It is modern, dazzling, and more importantly, authoritative and trustworthy.

;

;We can’t wait for hospital beds, and there is no need to wait. The doctor read grandma's medical records and the films taken by the county hospital, repeated the same conclusion, prescribed medicine, and said: Just go home and take care of her, old man. Mingfang received her assignment. She needed to prescribe medicines for her grandmother on a regular basis and mail them back to her hometown. The county hospital did not have them. The pain and drugs often make grandma unconscious. When she wakes up, she doesn't know whether it's day or night. She doesn't recognize Mingfang or her mother, and she only talks about her uncle. Mom's spirits are high when she's tired, but being forgotten can bring tears to her eyes.

;

;Mingfang took her grandmother and mother to the place where they lived, and happened to meet a man who got up to work the night shift. The mother obviously did not expect that there would be a man in the shared house. She thought that Mingfang, who had studied in college, should rent a house like a student dormitory. My mother held my grandma’s wheelchair and stood in the narrow public area, not wanting to go in. She said she wanted to go out and find a hotel. Mingfang grabbed her mother and lowered her voice and said: It's late at night, do you have a lot of money? Nowadays, all shared apartments are owned by the second landlord, so they don't care about gender matching. Besides, they are a family, and there is a girl, so we are not compatible with me.

;

;At night, grandma was asleep, but mother couldn't sleep. Mingfang said: Order some midnight snacks. This is a small hobby that Mingfang's mother has retained. For a while, when she worked the night shift at the county's fiberglass factory, she would leave a bowl of sweet tea for herself in the electric cooker in advance. Apart from that, like all mothers, she has no hobbies.

;

;Before there was no sister, their family was still in H City. My mother cooked in a narrow rental house. At noon, she would cook crayfish, seal them with plastic wrap, and let Mingfang take them to the canteen at the entrance of the alley. Put it in their refrigerator, and then ask the boss to leave two bottles of cold beer in advance, and pay for it together when Mingfang's father comes back in the evening. In the evening, when the temperature drops, the crayfish is cooked again, the family of three turns on the TV, and the parents drink some cold beer. It is a rare leisure time. At that time, "Little Yu'er and Hua Wuque" was broadcast on TV. Jiang Yuyan was still looking pitiful. Xiao Yu'er and the little fairy were fighting and making trouble, but the tragedy had not yet begun.

;

;Mom dipped her hands in the soup and suddenly said: Crayfish grow up eating feces and mud. Mingfang smiled. This is what grandma often said. In summer, the rivers and ponds near grandma's house are full of crayfish. It is said that there were not so many in the past. After someone raised them, the lobster seedlings leaked out. Grandpa would take a clean paint bucket and use cotton thread and bamboo poles to catch lobsters. While grandma despised the crayfish as dirty and an invasive species, she washed the crayfish in the paint bucket until the flesh turned white, removed the heads, pulled out the threads, and cut off the tips of the shrimp claws. The next moment, the lobster is put into the pot, the water drops meet the rapeseed oil, the cooking wine shakes hands with the ginger and garlic, and the aroma wafts from the kitchen to the front of the hall. Grandpa retorted: Go fishing with mud and see if you can catch it? He wiped his face with a wet towel and poured hot water into the blue plastic teacup with the welcoming pine printed on it. Because the tea stain was too thick, the color of the tea was not light at all. Ask Mingfang to stand in front of the electric fan and let her cool down. She will drink this when doing small jobs in the afternoon to cool her down and relieve the heat. She will also swallow a pack of rendan before going out.

;

;Now that Mingfang thinks about it, it was a really good time, and everyone at home was ready. But she had just returned to the village from H City and was in no mood to eat. Even if we are a family, our happy times cannot overlap.

;

;My mother cleaned up the takeout boxes, laid the floor, and asked her how much money she still had. Mingfang handed the phone to her mother. Mom looks at Mingfang’s savings balance just like she looked at Mingfang’s report card many years ago. Finally, she sighed and said slowly: It's not that long ago, and it's not like ordinary people can get ahead in H City. You want to stay, I thought the same way back then, but unfortunately the opportunity has passed, so consider going home.

;

;Only then did Mingfang realize that her mother had come here for another purpose: her experience card had expired. Graduates from ordinary universities and liberal arts majors from a small family and a small place have a limited time limit to live here. The depreciation rate of her bank card balance, academic qualifications, profession, ability to endure hardships and stand hard work, and even the rate of death of her conscience are all damaging her progress bar.

;

; 

;

;;2.;

;

;Although her mother has been working and Mingfang went to work directly after graduating from university, the family is still short of money. When she was in college, Mingfang was drawn into a part-time job group, which gathered a group of students with the worst conditions in the school. There are all kinds of jobs in the news: helping others with classes for ten yuan, helping others run a physical test for 800 meters for fifty yuan, working in a small restaurant near the school, calculated based on the length of time, including three meals a day, and there are also people who can pay for orders. You can exchange your identity information for money. In the year of graduation, the group was blamed and the group was about to go to jail. When she dragged her suitcase out of the school gate, there were banners hanging at the door and parents gathered together. There were photos posted on the telephone poles--probably from the entrance interview--with a dark face and combed hair just after military training. A girl with bright eyes who can’t draw her eyebrows yet. Looking from a distance, green smoke and firelight float in the air, rising from the enamel basin depicting the Chinese characters for "Yuanyang" and "Happiness". What is the currency of that world, what difficulties or desires does the protagonist of the incident have, and when did she sink into the lake in the school? No one knows, but everyone only remembers the money, because of the money. The message sent by the group owner was "Software loan, complete an order, commission 400, professional team." Mingfang also saw it. When her fingertips crossed the line of words, she brushed against some danger. Mingfang felt that the dead girl was herself, life and death were delicate, and for whom the death bell tolled. When Mingfang saw the face crying in pain, her tears turned into snot. She breathed in her sorrow and ran towards the oncoming bus. She raised her suitcase with all her strength and squeezed on. Mingfang has to catch a train to H City, where she has been away for many years, to take the first class in her life. Even if she was embarrassed, she planned to rush forward.

;

;Mingfang was very difficult and sad. She couldn't tell her mother about the dangers and unreachable situations that were just one step away. Likewise, her mother would not tell her.

;

;In the past, her mother said that she did not want Mingfang to stay in the village and spend the whole year with her when she had a runny nose and spent the New Year in a sloppy way so that the whole family could see her. The mother wanted to stay at home, but the father needed the boy and the mother's spare uterus after a short rest, so they formed an outside family of three in H city.

;

;After working in decoration for several years, my father slowly tried to contract construction sites and decoration. He contacted fellow villagers in H City and would bring people out from the village. Trying to bring together bricklayers, masons, painters, as well as young, middle-aged and elderly people without retirement wages who have physical strength. They build and paint the houses in H City, hoping that one day, they will emerge from among the countless ruins. , earn a bright future.

;

;In Mingfang’s impression, her father was always dusty and covered in debris from building materials. They moved frequently, wherever there was a construction site and surrounded by blue iron sheets, the Mingfang family would move there. During the years when the three of them lived in a tin work shed, Mingfang's father was on the construction site, and her mother had to cook for them in a big iron pot that didn't taste good, heated unevenly, and the rice was cooked. No one tasted it except Mingfang. Heavy salt and heavy oil, wrapped in protein and carbohydrates, are replenished into the exhausted body one bite at a time. Hungry and tired people can't taste the food. On weekends, my father took Mingfang and her mother to play under the landmark TV Tower. They took the elevator up to buy tickets, and they stretched their necks below to look. Mingfang bought a ticket and went up after work, and realized that what she saw when standing under the tower were human heads, while what she saw when standing on the tower was the scenery. She and her mother listened to her father's heroic words. He said: After a few more years of hardship, his son will be able to take the college entrance examination here.

;

;On the way home, they went in the wrong direction and wandered around in the intricate alleys. Scenic spots, landmarks, and high-rise buildings are always surrounded by dilapidated houses, like a symbiotic relationship in nature. There are smelly ditches, garbage dumps, pickled goods hanging under the eaves, and you can see a face of salt when you look up. Dad found a small shop and was only willing to buy a bottle of mineral water. He gave it to Mingfang and her mother to drink. After being called "outsider" many times, he asked for a way out and walked home without saying a word. He was so thirsty that he went straight to the tap and drank a lot of raw water.

;

;"Outlander" is a curse word in Mingfang's heart. Mingfang heard it more than once from when she remembered it to when she left H City. Later, she and her local classmates in H City learned to speak the local dialect fluently, and she went out on her own. Even her Mandarin had a hint of the H City dialect. The final sound of the H City dialect is soft and gentle, even if it comes out through a boy's vocal cords, someone will be willing to reach out and support it. Mom and Dad said that Mingfang was already a local, but Mingfang knew that no, she was far from here. It was just that there were almost no locals on her parents' construction site, so she could fake it. The area where Mingfang Junior High School is admitted is very strange, like the Mandarin Duck Hot Pot, the Tai Chi Bagua Diagram or the Three-Colored Cup. It is something with clear boundaries, stable internal structure, and cannot be dismantled. Dad's engineering team demolished it here, and other engineering teams built it here. The protected buildings that must not be harmed are also here. They are guarded by towering plane trees and exquisite copper fences. In the first semester, the school organized a trip to the botanical garden. As spring and summer transitioned, the temperature rose. It was too warm in the bus before the air conditioner was turned on. Mingfang got motion sick, but could not open the window. After getting off the bus, she carried a plastic bag on the roadside. Vomit. Strangely, no one in the class got carsick. They seemed to be used to the smell of gasoline and the sudden braking at traffic lights. Even when Mingfang felt nauseous, they would keep stuffing sweet snacks into their mouths. The teacher gently stroked Mingfang's back and said: Little girl, you are missing a seat in the car. Mingfang suddenly realized that they all had cars at home.

;

;This is the period when Mingfang’s family is in the best economic situation, so Mingfang can go to school here. They moved into an old building that will be demolished in a few years. They have a toilet and a TV, but no air conditioning or refrigerator. At the same time, Mingfang's mother became pregnant. During the prenatal check-up, my father couldn’t wait to ask the doctor: Is it a boy or a girl? can not say? Then bring a handle? The doctor scolded him sternly, but he not only did not refute, but also showed a flattering and tolerant smile. An aunt from the same hometown who came to H City to work as a nanny secretly told Mingfang: If it were a younger brother, I'm afraid your parents wouldn't have so much time to spend on you. You should study hard. When her mother was pregnant, Mingfang's unpleasant feeling was a spark. After hearing her aunt's words, the spark touched the air and completely ignited. The gender of the fetus is a choice between two choices. People always have to choose between one of the two. Fifty percent is luck or risk, hard to say. Mingfang is worried about herself, and even more worried about her mother.

;

;My mother gave birth before the winter vacation, and Mingfang transferred to another school at this time. Dad's salary, mother's energy, and the space of the rental house seemed to always be enough for three people. If there was one more person, Mingfang would end up in the same place. However, even if you can finish junior high school, if you don't have a hukou in H City, you have to go back to your hometown to study in high school, change a set of textbooks, and write a different set of test papers to take the college entrance examination. This day will definitely come, but it’s just ahead of time. Before leaving, her deskmate gave her a set of "Unsolved Mysteries of the World". He said she should read it as a novel, it was very interesting. On the day after the exam, Mingfang told him that she might not come to school next semester. He nodded steadily, because Mingfang had warned him about his future since his mother was pregnant. For this purpose, he specially prepared loose-leaf student records in advance, took out one sheet for Mingfang to write on, and then took out another sheet for himself to write on. The one in his hand was his contact information and message. He wrote: Never be sad about separation. People who want to meet can always meet. He is a man of great confidence, and is far more interested in things past and future than in the present.

;

; 

;

;;3.;

;

;Mom and dad are a bonding alliance, but when gender comes to the fore, the alliance collapses . At her sister's full-moon banquet, no one teased Mingfang with words like "brother". Instead, they advised Mingfang's father very sensibly, saying: It doesn't matter if it's a daughter, it's the same with daughters. The father was persuaded not to look at his sleeping sister, but to drink heavily. He couldn't even squeeze out a perfunctory smile when he saw Mingfang, and asked mechanically: Are you full? There was a banquet in the yard, and the cook who was "happy to the door" was a smiling, fat young man. He was too big. He stood at the gate of the yard drinking fruit oranges and blocked Mingfang's path. Mingfang walked around her, ignored her father, and walked around. A large circle of smoke created by the men's communication entered the house. My mother was holding her sister and sitting on the bench in front of the hall. When she saw Mingfang coming in, tears welled up in her eyes. There were red envelopes, gift cards, cigarettes and wine stacked on the Eight Immortals table, and my sister's diapers, milk powder, and baby bottles were piled on the bed in the room. Mingfang put down her schoolbag and walked over to take a look at her sister. It was wet and cold in the winter, and the heater was turned on very loudly. The blowing made parts of her body hot, but her body was cold. She was very small, with a red face, and fell asleep with her mother's nipple in her mouth. Today is not a celebration for her, but a gift from her.

;

;Dad finished smoking and went into the house. Mom got up and put her sister on the bed, pulled off her clothes, covered her chest, and finally tore and beat her father: Do you really want your son that much? Who are you showing your face to? Dad glanced at Mingfang, lowered his head, and said: No more, I don’t have that life.

;

;It turns out that giving birth to a daughter means accepting your fate.

;

;After confinement, Mingfang’s mother hugged her sister and got on the bus to the county seat. Her grandmother did not give up persuading Mingfang’s mother, telling her to go back later and take good care of her body until her sister is older. Mom shook her head and said to grandma: You don’t know how many stores like this are around where you live, and it’s hard to guard against them.

;

;Mingfang knew what kind of store it was. A woman sat in front of a narrow door knitting a sweater or crocheted slippers, squatting on the ground and eating watermelon. When her mother walked past her, she ran and pulled her flip-flops away from their toes and the other four. Mingfang lowered her head and saw that the meaning was unclear. tattoo with cigarette burn scars.
